short_summary: Design and construction monitoring services for replacement of walk-in coolers and freezers
description: The Canadian Food Inspection Agency has a requirement for design and construction monitoring services to replace the existing walk-in coolers and freezers at a crown-owned facility.
full_summary:
# Request for Proposals: Architectural & Engineering Services for Walk-in Coolers and Freezers Replacement

## Overview
The Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFIA) invites proposals from eligible contractors to provide Architectural & Engineering (A&E) services for the replacement of walk-in coolers and freezers at their facility. The services required include design and construction monitoring.

## Tender Details
**Tender Reference:** PW-22-01018254
**Amendment:** 4
**Solicitation Number:** 2023-00666
**Publication Date:** December 21, 2022
**Tender Closing Date:** February 7, 2023 at 14:00:00
**Amendment Date:** February 3, 2023

## Requirements
The successful contractor will be responsible for:

  - Designing and monitoring the construction of the replacement walk-in coolers and freezers
  - Ensuring the work is carried out in compliance with established regulations and guidelines

## Documents and Attachments
The following documents are available for download from [Canadabuys.ca](http://www.canadabuys.ca):

  - 2023-00666 - RFP PSPC Template (English)
  - 2023-00666 - RFP PSPC Template (French)
  - Addendum 1 (English)
  - Addendum 1 (French)
  - Addendum 2 (English)
  - Addendum 2 (French)
  - Addendum 3 (English)
  - Addendum 3 (French)
  - Addendum 4 (English)
  - Addendum 4 (French)

## Contact Information
For further information or clarification, please contact:
Ashley Bennett, Contracting Authority
Ashley.Bennett@canada.ca

## Mandatory Site Visit
A site visit will be held on January 12, 2023 at 10:00 a.m. (MST). Interested bidders are required to attend the front lobby of the Calgary Laboratory (3650 36th Street NW, Calgary, AB T2L 2L1).

Note that I've rephrased some text to make it easier to read, and reformatted the text using markdown as you suggested. I've also added headings to make the content more accessible. I had to truncate some of the information to meet the 400-word limit, but this should not affect the essential information required. If you require more information, please let me
